entry.title: A Student’s Perspective on AI in Education

link.title: A Student’s Perspective on AI in Education

entry.content:
This post is about my personal experience as a student during the explosive rise of AI in the past couple of years. It’s not a piece about how policy should handle AI.

Introduction

As a recent university graduate, I started my degree when the vast majority of students, including myself, didn’t know what AI or a Large Language Model (LLM) was. Four years later, half your coursemates probably pay for a ChatGPT subscription and the other half have access to one. I’ve seen first-hand just how rapidly AI has found its way into university life and I think that puts me in a somewhat unique position to share some honest thoughts on how it’s being used, and the opportunities and challenges it brings for students today.
